decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly deploying a swarm of artifact creatures, using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to ramp up mana production. Cranial Plating provides a powerful boost to attack power, while Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager can quickly pump up the team. With a mix of evasion from creatures like Vault Skirge and Inkmoth Nexus, as well as protection from Spellskite and Etched Champion, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact-based creatures and equipment. The key is to quickly establish a board presence and close out the game before the opponent can mount a defense.

The main strategy of this deck is to flood the board with cheap artifact creatures and use powerful equipment like Cranial Plating to quickly deal damage to the opponent. With the help of Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager, the deck can quickly build up a threatening board presence. The key is to utilize cards like Springleaf Drum and Mox Opal to generate mana efficiently while keeping up aggressive pressure with cards like Signal Pest and Vault Skirge. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and powerful equipment to secure a quick victory.

The main focus of this UR Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategies using counterspells and removal spells, while maintaining card advantage through cards like Ancestral Vision and Snapcaster Mage. The deck also utilizes disruptive enchantments like Blood Moon and Spreading Seas to disrupt the opponent's mana base. The win condition for the deck is to control the board until it can play threats like Tarmogoyf, Batterskull, and Goblin Dark-Dwellers to close out the game. The deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent's threats.

The deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures with various abilities to create powerful combos and outvalue opponents. With a combination of tutors like Chord of Calling and removal spells like Path to Exile, the deck can control the board while setting up game-winning combos with cards like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Restoration Angel. The deck also includes resilient creatures like Kitchen Finks and Thrun, the Last Troll to withstand aggression, along with disruption from cards like Aven Mindcensor and Spellskite. Overall, the deck aims to be versatile and adaptive in different matchups.

The deck revolves around assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and put into play at the right moment using cards like Chord of Calling. The goal is to create a powerful synergy between the creatures, utilizing their various abilities and interactions to control the board and eventually win the game. Key creatures like Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn can create game-winning combos, while the supporting creatures provide value and disruption. This deck aims to be versatile and adaptable, able to answer a wide range of threats and strategies.

This deck is focused on quickly ramping up to play powerful Eldrazi creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells and hand disruption. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the color requirements of the Eldrazi creatures while also providing early game acceleration. The inclusion of Tarmogoyf adds additional pressure to the board and helps close out games quickly. With a combination of aggressive creatures and versatile removal spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize their board.

The deck revolves around using Elves to generate massive amounts of mana, allowing you to play powerful spells like Collected Company and Chord of Calling to search for key combo pieces like Shaman of the Pack and Ezuri, Renegade Leader. By utilizing mana dorks like Heritage Druid and Nettle Sentinel, you can quickly swarm the board with Elves and overwhelm your opponent. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Reclamation Sage and Elvish Champion to handle threats. The mana base includes lands like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx and Cavern of Souls to support the Elf tribal theme.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Tower, Power Plant) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. The key concept revolves around using this mana to play powerful Eldrazi threats such as Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and World Breaker, as well as planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to control the game. The deck also includes removal spells like Pyroclasm and Oblivion Stone to deal with threats, while cards like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying help find the necessary pieces to set up the UrzaTron lands.

This deck aims to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant) to generate huge amounts of mana and play powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn Liberated. It utilizes cards like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to find the Tron lands quickly, while also including board wipes like Pyroclasm and Firespout to handle aggressive decks. With a mix of removal, ramp, and big threats, this deck seeks to outvalue opponents and win through overwhelming late-game power.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disruption, removal, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By combining efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate with hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage and Ancestral Vision helps to outvalue the opponent in the long game. Additionally, the deck has versatile threats like Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet and Goblin Dark-Dwellers to close out the game efficiently.

The main concept of this Grixis Control deck is to efficiently control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. The deck aims to control the game by countering key spells, dealing with threats, and generating card advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage and Tasigur, the Golden Fang. Using a mix of proactive and reactive spells, the deck seeks to maintain control of the game until it can close out with threats like Delver of Secrets and Kolaghan's Command.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan by playing disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Leonin Arbiter while also utilizing Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Eldrazi Displacer to apply pressure. The deck also includes cards like Tidehollow Sculler and Thoughtseize to further disrupt your opponent's hand. With the help of cards like Flickerwisp and Aether Vial, you can reuse and abuse your disruptive creatures to outvalue your opponent. Additionally, the deck includes interaction like Path to Exile and Relic of Progenitus to handle threats and disrupt graveyard strategies.

This deck focuses on using cheap and efficient creatures with infect abilities to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By combining pump spells and protection cards, the goal is to deal 10 poison counters to the opponent and win the game. The mana base is versatile, allowing for early plays and ensuring access to the necessary colors. The deck also includes card draw and selection to maintain consistency. Overall, the strategy is to execute a quick and lethal infect combo before the opponent can mount a defense.

The deck revolves around assembling Jeskai Ascendancy and using it in combination with various mana creatures and cantrips to generate a powerful combo engine. By chaining spells together and untapping creatures, the deck aims to dig through the deck, generate mana, and eventually win the game through a large, game-ending spell. The key is to set up and protect the combo while efficiently cycling through the deck to find the necessary pieces for victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly cycle through creatures with cycling abilities like Street Wraith and Architects of Will, while also ramping up mana with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Fulminator Mage. By using cards like Demonic Dread and Violent Outburst, the deck can cascade into Living End, which will then bring back all the cycled creatures from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent with a board full of powerful creatures. Additionally, cards like Beast Within and Ingot Chewer provide removal and disruption options to control the game.

The primary focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by utilizing aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent from the beginning with efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also employing direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike to finish off the opponent. The deck's goal is to win the game as fast as possible by overwhelming the opponent with a constant stream of powerful and direct damage spells, combined with efficient and aggressive creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using aggressive creatures like Wild Nacatl, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Boros Charm to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to react quickly or risk losing the game. The mana base is built around efficient land cards that can produce the necessary colors for casting spells, ensuring a smooth and consistent gameplay experience.

The deck focuses on creating extra turns with cards like Temporal Mastery, Time Warp, and Walk the Aeons while controlling the opponent's resources with spells like Cryptic Command and Spell Snare. It also utilizes card draw and hand manipulation with cards like Serum Visions and Jace Beleren to ensure consistency in drawing the combo pieces. By combining extra turns with card advantage and control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through overwhelming advantage. Additionally, it uses Elixir of Immortality to prevent deck out.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively control the board while utilizing cheap spells and disruption to lower the opponent's life total quickly. Cards like Delver of Secrets, Death's Shadow, and Gurmag Angler provide early pressure, while Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Stubborn Denial disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Dismember to deal with threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy of applying pressure early and maintaining control throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up storm count by reducing the cost of your spells with Goblin Electromancer and Pyromancer Ascension, then use spells like Pyretic Ritual and Manamorphose to generate mana and draw cards. Once you have a high storm count, you can cast Grapeshot multiple times to deal lethal damage to your opponent. Past in Flames allows you to recast your spells from the graveyard, while cantrips like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand help you dig for the pieces you need to go off.

The main focus of this Naya Zoo deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal. By utilizing efficient creatures such as Tarmogoyf, Knight of the Reliquary, and Wild Nacatl, along with powerful spells like Lightning Bolt and Path to Exile, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, cards like Collected Company and Voice of Resurgence provide versatility and resilience to removal. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to deploy threats quickly and efficiently.
